en: Unknown Woman, formerly called Anne, Lady Hundson (c. 1529â€“1607)

The sitter's complexion in this finely detailed portrait is unusually dark for Hilliard's palette, and the (Fe) MA-XRF map shows that this is likely caused by the unusual presence of earth pigment in the carnation.
The playing card back of this Hilliard miniature was not accessible for the analysis, but the mercury (Hg) MA-XRF map shows the presence of a single heart, at a sideways orientation, made of vermilion.

The UV image shows that this miniature is in a good state of preservation. The pale orange UV fluorescence colour (for instance evident on the ruff) is due to the presence of lead white.

Silver has been detected in the pupils, presumably used to indicate a reflection of light, and gold and silver have been used extensively for the delicate ornamentation of the dress.
